title: What parts of France have mostly ethnic French people (no immigrants or descendants of immigrants from other countries)? - Quora

response.answer_text: “What parts of France have mostly ethnic French people (no immigrants or descendants of immigrants from other countries)? “ None. There is not one person in France who is “ethnic French”, because this does not exist. We all have ancestors from somewhere else. The place now called France is on a massive migration route between the Mediterranean and North Europe. It has been so since the Neandertal first step foot on this continent. Please stop trying to manipulate us like you manipulated the US population.

I think this question sounds… a little bit biased. Like everywhere in the Western world, including America, people coming from other countries go there where they hope to find work. In Spain, for instance, you’ll find women employed to gather strawberries under a scorching sun. They come from Marocco, Romania… In France, some immigrants are generally doing some unqualified work ethnic French people despise, unless they are physicians from Romania and other East European countries. This is called “brain drain”. A lot of other persons coming in “rich” countries from the poorest areas of the planet just gather in cities. They are not to be blamed for not being “ethnic French”. To answer you from my own experience, I live in France, but I do not know such places you are looking for. They must be where tourists do not go, and are not necessarily the ones you’d like. People hating foreigners are to be found everywhere. Sadly.
